intro: Psychotria leucantha, commonly known as the white psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria leucantha is notable for its role in traditional medicine and its association with the hallucinogenic properties of certain related species.
